title: Peter McPherson (soccer)
text:
Peter McPherson (born 18 June 1984) is an Australian <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">footballer</a> who plays for <a href="NewFM">NewFM</a> side <a href="West%20Wallsend%20FC">West Wallsend</a>.
Career.
Born in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales">New South Wales</a> metropolitan area of <a href="Newcastle%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Newcastle</a>, McPherson made one appearance for <a href="A-League">A-League</a> side the <a href="Newcastle%20Jets">Newcastle Jets</a>, coming on as a second-half substitute in the 5–1 defeat to <a href="Perth%20Glory%20FC">Perth Glory</a> in October 2005. He then moved to <a href="Sydney%20Olympic%20FC">Sydney Olympic FC</a> on loan, and returned to the Newcastle Jets after his loan finished. McPherson then moved permanently to <a href="Sydney%20Olympic%20FC">Sydney Olympic FC</a>, where he played during the 2007 season. In 2008, he moved to study Physical Education in the United States at <a href="Michigan%20State%20University">Michigan State University</a>. He rejoined <a href="Sydney%20Olympic%20FC">Sydney Olympic FC</a> in January 2009. and played his first game after returning to Sydney on 2 February 2009 against <a href="West%20Sydney%20Berries">West Sydney Berries</a>.
Privates.
Outside of football, McPherson works as a <a href="Physical%20Education">Physical Education</a> teacher. His other interests include tennis, golf and cricket.
